meanings.definition: The quality or state of being invasive.
meanings.sent1: The invasiveness of the plant species led to its rapid takeover of the garden.
meanings.sent2: The invasiveness of the virus made it difficult to contain the outbreak.
meanings.sent3: The invasiveness of the new puppy's playfulness brought joy to the whole family.
meanings.sent4: The invasiveness of the idea spread like wildfire among the students.
meanings.sent5: The invasiveness of the sales pitch left a lasting impression on the customers.

meanings.definition: The tendency to spread and cause harm or disruption.
meanings.sent1: The invasiveness of rumors in the small town caused unnecessary panic.
meanings.sent2: The invasiveness of the invasive species threatened the local ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The invasiveness of the prank led to laughter echoing through the halls.
meanings.sent4: The invasiveness of the noise pollution disrupted the peaceful neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The invasiveness of the gossip quickly reached every corner of the office.
